Description: -Either I stay here or I just die.- A resident of the Voronezh region is trying to rescue her husband from an illegal basement in ZaitsevoAs Valentina Avilova from Novovoronezh told ASTRA, her husband Alexey signed a contract and went to war last fall. On August 26, he decided to escape from the unit and return home. He did not tell her the reasons why he did this. He stayed at home for only a few days - soon he was stopped on the street to have his documents checked and taken to the police station. There it turned out that he was wanted.-My husband called me and said that he had been detained, so I accordingly came there. We sat in the police for two hours, the military commandant‚Äôs office arrived. He said: -Guys, I‚Äôm not going anywhere. Either I stay here or I just die.- A scuffle broke out, and eventually he was handcuffed, forced into a car, and taken to the military commandant‚Äôs office. I called the duty officer there, they don‚Äôt provide information - it‚Äôs the weekend. And three days later the prosecutor‚Äôs office told me that he was sent to Zaitsevo,- says Valentina.Valentina says that Alexey left at home all his personal belongings - from a military ID to a telephone, on which his comrades periodically write. Answering them, she found out that some of her husband‚Äôs colleagues also passed through Zaitsevo.-One tells me, I know what kind of place this is, I was there for two weeks. They should at least have informed me as a relative that my husband was detained under such and such an article, and not torture people and mock me. They are not even allowed to go to the toilet, people walk under themselves. Up to 100 people sit there at a time. You wouldn‚Äôt wish this on your enemy,- Valentina told ASTRA.According to Valentina, her husband went to war not out of patriotic convictions or for the sake of money, but because -he was interested in - - he did not serve in military service for medical reasons. - When he made his choice, it was a shock for me. We bought tents so that we wouldn‚Äôt sleep on the cold ground. I think this is not normal. Why did they go to fight then? They, like patriots, went for Russia. What did you get in the end? Such an appeal? What money? What is shown on TV is all nonsense,- says Valentina.Valentina has sent appeals to the presidential administration, as well as to several deputies, but is worried that the answer to them will not arrive on time , and now -every minute counts.--I just need to get my husband out of there. Let him be punished according to the law, they will give him a prison term, but he did not deserve what is happening in Zaitsevo. I don't think anyone deserves this. I owe my husband my whole life, I cannot leave him. I've known him for over 20 years. I‚Äôm ready to do anything for him, but he needs to be pulled back out of this hole. And I don‚Äôt even know if he‚Äôs alive or not. My head is just a mess. But I won‚Äôt forgive myself if I don‚Äôt help him,- says Valentina. Throughout the entire full-scale war, ASTRA talks about illegal prisons for -refuseniks-, where military personnel i>threatsandvarious torturedforced into deadly assaults. Description: ASTRA: Kadyrovites opened fire in the center of Valuyki, Belgorod region. A video appeared on the Internet in which a man in civilian clothes fires a burst of pistol into the sky and dances Lezginka surrounded by other men in military uniform. As the publication -Ashes- writes... A Chechen from Akhmat threw a grenade at the car of a military man from Dagestan in the Belgorod region 35-year-old Kurban Akaev is the commander of a repair company from the 752nd regiment, which is based in the city of Valuiki. Kurban is Dargin by origin. When asked by an ASTRA correspondent whether his nationality is the cause of the conflict, Kurban replies-I didn‚Äôt have any conflict with him.- On the night of September 29, Kurban's vacation began. He met him at the Roly-Poly cafe in Valuyki, chatting in a company of about a dozen friends near his Toyota Camry. Police officers and a company of about 20 Chechens stood nearby. According to Kurban, before the flash he heard someone pulling the pin from a grenade. -It[the grenade] rolled a little and suddenly exploded. An officer stood next to me - he bent over. I see he‚Äôs bleeding from his head because of the fragments.- The wounded officer, says Kurban, was afraid to go to the hospital so that his unit would not accuse him of being AWOL. According to Kurban, the military man who attacked him serves in the Akhmat regiment -When he threw a grenade, panic set in, people began to run inside and he shouted ‚ÄòAkhmat strength‚Äô. He raised his hand and I recognized him immediately,- says Kurban. As a result of the explosion, his car was scratched many times by shrapnel, and in one place his door was broken.When asked whether the grenade was a live one, Kurban answers in the affirmative. The owner of the Roly-Poly cafe, in a conversation with ASTRA, suggested that the grenade could have been a -dummy-, since there was no serious damage as a result of the explosion and there was no need to call an ambulance. Kurban says that the Chechen who attacked him was together with two other people. Chechens from a company of 20 people approached him after the explosion to discuss car repairs. -They came running, shouting that he would do [repair] your car <..> Then they got into a fight. An innocent man stood with a phone and talked - and they attacked him, they thought that he was filming them,- says the military man. According to Kurban, the Chechens have long been -lawless- in Valuyki. In July, in this city, soldiers from Chechnya danced lezginka and shot in the air - after which the head of the district said that -measures have been taken to prevent such cases.- This is not the first time that Cafe Roly-Poly has been in the news: in March, residents of Valuyka they called for it to be closedbecause of two strippers who washed each other during the performance.

This year -The public ceremony will not take place, but everyone who considers it important for themselves to honor the memory of the Jews of the city of Pushkin who fell victims of the Nazi genocide can independently come to the -Formula of Sorrow- monument at any time 6 October, on the anniversary of the tragic events of 1941,- the Jewish Community Center reports on social networks St. Petersburg.

Title: üñº -They were aware of the planned murder and agreed to participa...
Description: -They were aware of the planned murder and agreed to participate in it.- ASTRA publishes a fragment from the decision to initiate the first known criminal case of the mass murder of Russian military personnel by its own command in the war in UkraineIn March 2024, the Main Military Investigation Department of the Investigative Committee in Lugansk opened a criminal case against the leadership  6th Motorized Rifle Division. This military formation was formed in 2022 and consists mainly of mobilized people. His command is accused of torturing their own military personnel - as well as their mass murder.The murder of 7 military personnel took place in the early morning of July 4, 2023 in the village of Bakhmutskoye, the so-called -DPR-. At that time, battles were still going on for this village - which the military from the 6th division took advantage of. They took their colleagues to the basement and threw 5 F-1 grenades there. The survivors of the explosion were finished off with a silent PB pistol. 19 Russian military personnel are listed as victims in the case. All of them were held at different times in the basements of apartment buildings in the city of Popasnaya -LPR-. According to the command, they were placed there for refusing to follow orders. There they were subjected to torture: they were beaten -with their feet, fists, and also with various objects and special equipment in the face and body.- The military was also denied access to food, water and hygiene products. Out of 19 victims, military prosecutors -saved- 8 people by dismissing the military personnel. Another military man escaped execution in Bakhmutskoye due to injury. For the first time, a criminal case against the command of the 6th division became known this summer from investigations of the Ukrainian portal -Suspilne-. The publication confirmed information about the criminal case in conversations with relatives of the murdered and murderers. To them, Ukrainian journalists introduced themselves as employees of -public television,- without specifying either the TV channel or the country of broadcasting. Among others, -Suspilna- was able to reach the wife of the commander of the 6th division, Marat Ospanov (call sign -Gyurza- - in the photo), whom investigators consider the main organizer of the massacre. This summer, his wife told reporters that Ospanov was being examined at a psychiatric clinic in Lugansk. According to Suspilne, 19 soldiers from the 6th division were sent to torture cellars in the city of Popasnaya due to publications on social networks of complaints about the conditions of service. ASTRA was among the first to publish these appeals from the military of the 6th division - for example, the complaint of those mobilized from the 1307th regiment that they were being used as -cannon fodder-. 5 of the 7 soldiers killed in Bakhmutsky served in this regiment.In total, there are 7 defendants in the criminal case. As ASTRA found out, the case was initiated under articles of abuse of power (parts 3 and 4 of article 286), unlawful deprivation of liberty (part 3 of article 127) and murder of two or more persons (part 2 of article 105).
